visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a one-dimensional composition of atmospheric layers with ordinal height data. Each layer's proportional representation uses synthetic unity values (all 1) to enable percentage stacking visualization, while height ranges and thermal properties derive from NASA's atmospheric models. The categorical ordering follows atmospheric stratification from space downward. Chart design employs Tufte's data-ink principles by eliminating non-essential axes and gridlines, focusing attention on the labeled composition bands. Cairo's perceptual principles manifest through color progression from dark (space-facing layers) to light (Earth-surface layers), creating intuitive depth perception. The 6-color palette maintains discriminability while ensuring print grayscale viability. Interactive tooltips provide supplemental physics data without visual clutter, adhering to Shneiderman's visual information-seeking mantra.
